e4: Maintaining the current policy is ethically problematic, even if it protects short-term stock price.  Switching to an unbiased reporting method improves transparency and long-term investor trust. The potential for temporary market reaction is outweighed by the benefits of ethical accounting practices and reduces the risk of future scandals or legal issues.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency, accuracy, and fairness.  It should present a complete and unbiased picture of the company's financial performance, avoiding any manipulation or selective disclosure of information to benefit certain stakeholders.  It should also comply with all applicable laws and regulations and be consistently applied.  Furthermore, an ethical policy considers the impact on all stakeholders, including retail investors who may lack sophisticated financial knowledge.
e6: I would ask about the specifics of the investor relations plan for communicating the policy change,  how they will mitigate the short-term market reaction, and  what steps will be taken to educate retail investors about the new, transparent reporting. I would also request a detailed analysis of the potential impact of the change on different investor groups.
